Industry Concentration
High industry concentration does not guarantee pricing power.
Absolute market share may not matter as much as a firm's market share relative to
its competitors. A firm may have a 50% market share, but if a single competitor has
the other 50%, their 50% share would not result in a great degree of pricing power.
Return on capital is limited by intense competition between the two firms.
Conversely, a firm that has a 10% market share when no competitor has more than
2% may have a good degree of pricing power and high return on capital.
